Hi, a beginners question on understanding  fitness sharing.

I've referrd t=
o http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/message/2292
which gives an outli=
ne of speciation & I've also looked at some of the
published 
papers, inc K=
en's Phd thesis

Heres my understading:

At sach generation copy one genome=
 from each species forward into the new 
generation. For all other genomes =
in the new generation, assign them
into one
of the existing species using t=
he compatibilty distance formula
delta =3D c1E/N +c2D/N + c3.W  . if no com=
patibility match found, start
a new species.


So far so good (I hope)

Nex=
t Ken's phd thesis refer to a calculated fitness sharing function fi.

This=
 function gets adjusted to f(dash)i by using the formula

f(dash)i =3D fi/S=
igma (j=3D1 to n) sh(delta)(i,j)


The bit I don't understand is what the t=
he original fitness fi is and
how its calculated.

(Is it supposed to repre=
sent the phenotype/networks closeness to the
target output?
i.e. if a netwo=
rk was 90% accurate, would fi =3D 0.9 ??)

Appreciate any clarification

Th=
anks

Mike
